content: 3 vs r4 single_crochet around the rightmost post of the v chain 2 counts as double_crochet turn piece so the top of the v is to your right working from right to left down the same double_crochet work 4 more double_crochet chain 1 turn piece so top of v is to your left work 5 double_crochet from left to right up the double_crochet forming the other side of the v scale made chain 1 skip next 5 single_crochet *5 double_crochet working down post of next double_crochet chain 1 5 double_crochet working up other side of v ch1 skip next 5 double_crochet * repeat *-* 2 more times join with slip_stitch to top of initial chain-3 3 scales 3 between-scale chs r5 chain 1 single_crochet into the double_crochet behind it from the r3 double_crochet row continuing to work in the r3 dcs work 9 more scs spread evenly over the next 6 dcs *work 1 single_crochet over both the next double_crochet from r3 and the chain-1 between scales from r4 this anchors the scale row to the previous row work 9 more scs spread evenly over the next 6 dcs * repeat *-* for the remaining scale slip_stitch to beginning single_crochet 30 scs r6 chain 3 counts as double_crochet double_crochet in same single_crochet v made *double_crochet in next 5 single_crochet 2 double_crochet in next single_crochet v * repeat *-* 4 more times join with slip_stitch to top of initial chain-3 35 dcs including the 5 vs r7 single_crochet around the rightmost post of the v chain 2 counts as double_crochet turn piece so the top of the v is to your right working from right to left down the same double_crochet work 4 more double_crochet chain 1 turn piece so top of v is to your left work 5 double_crochet from left to right up the double_crochet forming the other side of the v scale made chain 1 skip next 5 single_crochet *5 double_crochet working down post of next double_crochet chain 1 5 double_crochet working up other side of v ch1 skip next 5 double_crochet * repeat *-* 4 more times join with slip_stitch to top of initial chain-3 5 scales 5 between-scale chs r8 chain 1 single_crochet into the double_crochet behind it from the r6 double_crochet row continuing to work in the r6 dcs work 9 more scs spread evenly over the next 6 dcs * work 1 single_crochet over both the next double_crochet from r6 and the chain-1 between scales from r7 work 8 more scs spread evenly over the next 6 dcs * alternating between 9 and 8 scs between scales repeat *-* for each of the remaining 3 scales slip_stitch to beginning single_crochet 48 scs r9 chain 3 counts as double_crochet double_crochet in same single_crochet v made *double_crochet in next 5 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next double_crochet v * repeat *-* 7 more times join with slip_stitch to top of initial chain-3 56 dcs including the 8 vs r10 single_crochet around the rightmost post of the v
